body.p:
Owensboro Ky. May 29/63
Gov. J. F. Robinson
Dear Sir

We enclose you the affidavit of J F Jones with the view to obtain a requisition on the Governor of Indiana for the body of Charles Wheeler who is guilty not only of the offense specified in the affidavit, but likewise of disposing of the notes to other parties by like fraudulent representatiions, and who besides is a Convicted horse theif and Counterfeiter -- This is his reputation & in this matter of the sale & transfer of the notes a grosser swindle was never perpetrated -- We suggest the names of M Sweetheimer & Wade H. Moore, both of whom were victimized by him as proper persons to receive him from the Custody of the authorities of Indiana --

Very truly yrs
Sweeney & Taylor
Wall & Ray
Attos. for the above parties
Submitted to Judge James for his opinion whether this Affdt presents proper case for requisition

I am of opinion the crime of obtaining property under false pretenses, as denounced by ยง2 Art. 13 Chap 28. Rev St. Vol 1 p. 392 -- is sufficently set forth in the affidavit dated -- sworn to 30th May 1863. And being a felony a proper case is presented for requisition for the fugitive under the act of congress -- 1 S. R. S. p. 71.
